question: Ava has a flower bed that is 194 feet long. Ava wants to fill her flower bed with plants. Ava's flowers grow 5 inches wide so she needs to leave 10.25 feet between every plant. Ava already owns 12 flowers. Each flowering plant costs €3 at the store, how much money will Ava spend at the store to fill up her flower bed?
answer:
Ava's flower bed is 194 feet / 10.25 feet per plant = <<194/10.25=18>>18 plants needed.
Ava needs to buy 18 plants - 12 plants = <<18-12=6>>6 plants needed to purchase.
Ava will spend 6 plants * €3 = €<<6*3=20>>20.
#### 20
